ds_grid_set_grid_region: This function can be used to copy the contents of a rectangular area of grid cells from one (previously defined) DS grid to another, or it can be used to copy a region from within the same grid. The following images illustrate both ways that this function can be used:
ds_grid_set_grid_region(index, source, x1, y1, x2, y2, xpos, ypos);
The index of the destination grid.
The index of the source grid.
The left position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The top position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The right position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The bottom position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The x position on the destination grid to copy the source region to.
The y position on the destination grid to copy the source region to.
This would copy the region of cells from (0,0) to (5,5) of the grid indexed in the variable "t_grid" and copy them to position (10,10) in the grid indexed in the variable "grid".
